title: ICE with mir-opt-level=2: Got a wide pointer where a scalar was expected

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
```rust
pub fn parse(version: ()) {
    p(&b'.', b"0");
}
#[inline(always)]
fn p(byte: &u8, s: &[u8]) {
    !(s[0] == *byte);
}
```

### Compiler output
```
error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/interpret/operand.rs:69: Got a wide pointer where a scalar was expected

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<Any>', src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:891:9

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.42.0-nightly (74c4e6a98 2019-12-27) running on x86_64-apple-darwin

note: compiler flags: -Z mir-opt-level=2 --crate-type lib

query stack during panic:

error: aborting due to previous error
```
